title: Mission Description
content: After defeating a manifestation ofNikador, Aglaea, the leader of theChrysos Heirs, guided us to Marmoreal Palace. There, she revealed the history of Amphoreus to us in a new and enlightening way.

text: (If the player approaches the water curtain)

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's this way. Come with me.

text: (If the player approaches any exit or door with a guard)

speaker: Holy City Guard
line: I'm sorry, this route is not open yet.

speaker: Aglaea
line: We're here at Marmoreal Palace, Okhema's public baths. Normally, this place would be much livelier.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This is a good place for our chat.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Both of you are new here, so it's only natural to be confused about the prophecy, Titans , and Chrysos Heirs that have been mentioned in passing. But I'd like you to learn about Amphoreus's history before I tell you more.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The bath sprites are excited to begin. This bath contains spirit water that has been blessed by the Ocean Titan . It can guide you back into the distant past. Go ahead, step in and listen to what the comforting ripples have to say.

text: Do we really have to get into the water?

speaker: Aglaea
line: If it'll make you feel better... I can avert my gaze.

text: Hear the creation myth of Amphoreus
Listen to the bath sprite's tale

speaker: Aglaea
line: Quiet your thoughts... Feelings are far more honest than words and can better satisfy your curiosity. Close your eyes and feel the warm ripples of water embrace you. Feel the delivery of this account from the seas.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The spirit water shall show you Amphoreus' distant and recent past .

text: (Some dialogue was removed from this section inVersion 3.2.)

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "Okie doke, make yourself comfortable~ Time for a history class on Amphoreus!"

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "Amphoreus started off as a ball of chaos!"

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "The three Fate Titans wrote laws to govern the world, another three Foundation Titans created the earth, ocean, and skies, and a different three Creation Titans designed and gave life to human beings — like you and me."

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "But three baddie Titans soon snuck in, bringing a terrible horrible disaster with them!"

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "So, the Titans got angry, and no one was willing to give in. Their followers then decided to do the same, fighting and killing each other."

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "Everyone fought for a really, really long time, disturbing and hurting all people living in the world. Until one day — something big happened!"

text: Yours truly descended upon your world!

children.speaker: Bath Sprite
children.line: "It's not your turn! No interrupting me in class!"

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "A prophecy appeared on Amphoreus! Something no one saw coming!"

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "The tripartite prophecy says there is only one way to stop this war."

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "Assemble a band of heroes powerful enough to take on the twelve Titans and reignite their Coreflames . Only then will their divine wrath abate, and peace return to the world."

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "We know this band of heroes by a certain name~ Any guesses? That's right! The Chrysos Heirs !"

speaker: Bath Sprite
line: "So, here's the takeaway: Eat well and train well, so you can grow up into a powerful hero and do your part for Amphoreus!"

speaker: Aglaea
line: Hmm? Is... something else wrong?

text: They're treating me like a child...
Sounds like they might have glossed over some things.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Is that so... Looks like you're a bit hard to please. Trusting and perceptive at the same time.

text: Amphoreus seems to be going through a rough patch.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Rough patch... That's a mild way to put it.

children.text: (Go back to dialogue choice with the option removed)

text: I still don't get what's going on with the Titans and Chrysos Heirs...

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: I suppose the things that are common knowledge to us are just a garbled mess to you. If we want to straighten out the threads of this world, perhaps I should explain things to you myself.

children.text: (Go back to dialogue choice with the option removed)

text: Do you really know nothing about what's beyond the sky?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: I seem to hear a note of pity in that question. Perhaps you find us to be weak and defenseless.

children.text: (Go back to dialogue choice with the option removed)

text: So, what do we do now?

speaker: Aglaea
line: We can move on to the problem at hand, now that both of you have some understanding of Amphoreus's history. Come with me.

title: Step Description
content: In the Chrysos Heirs bath, Aglaea affirmed our good intentions in her way, and it seems Okhema is willing to welcome us as honored guests. Let's hope this trailblazing expedition continues to unfold as smoothly.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Please give me a moment.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The way up from here leads to a bath that the Council granted exclusively to the Chrysos Heirs. The bath is strictly off limits to anyone other than the Heirs.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I'm willing to make an exception, considering you're guests from beyond the sky. But if I were to bring both of you in at once... I'd be blatantly disrespecting our traditions.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: It's probably more of a "hero's privilege."

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Seems like prophesied heroes and civilians aren't treated equally in Okhema.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ Why don't you go up with her, (Trailblazer)? I don't mind waiting for you here.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You have a very considerate partner. Follow me, then.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ Why don't you go up with her, (Trailblazer)? I don't mind waiting for you here.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ Take a seat, (Trailblazer). Make yourself comfortable, then close your eyes.

text: Why do I have a bad feeling about this...

speaker: Aglaea
line: I won't force you, but... people hope to regard one another with bare honesty when they enter a bath. Are you willing to trust me?

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Thank you. You can also move a little to your left. The water is warmer there.

text: (Follow her suggestion and move a little to your left.)

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: ...You don't trust me?

children.text: "Why should I trust you?" That was your immediate response. However, you and Dan Heng need to build good relationships with the locals to complete your trailblazing journey.
"At least cooperate for now and try to earn her trust," you persuade yourself.
(Move a little to your left.)

text: You move to the left. How wondrous — You've only moved a few centimeters, but the water around you has become distinctly warmer.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Now place your left hand onto the bench. Lift your arm up with your palm facing forward, and part your fingers slightly...

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: ...I understand now. You do not really distrust me, you just wish to show your rebellious side.

children.text: You feel your cheeks warm up and quickly switch hands.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Yes, you're doing great. Alright, it's about time I formally introduce myself: I am Aglaea the Goldweaver, dressmaster of Okhema and one of the Chrysos Heirs of Amphoreus. The trust placed in me is how I came to lead the Chrysos Heirs in our mission today.

speaker: Aglaea
line: My duty may be to weave lavish robes, but I most enjoy coming to these baths in my personal time. Garments are shields after all, hiding both our bodies and what we truly think...

speaker: Aglaea
line: This place though, is where we can drop our cloaks of pretense, for the waters shall bring us closer together.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ You can open your eyes now, (Trailblazer).

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Distant Travelers, Listen to this World's Prayer 1.mp4

speaker: Aglaea
line: Look, we are joined together now.

text: Wha... Is this some kind of ritual?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: You're not wrong to think of it that way.

text: Wha... Is this some kind of trap?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Trap? Hardly. Think of it as a ritual that allows us to communicate.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The golden threads of Mnestia entwine us, capable of sensing even the slightest quiver. We are bound to speak the truth to each other this way.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You will learn the truth about this world from me, and in return, I ask for you to promise me something.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Fulfill this pact between us, and you can expect your journey on Amphoreus to be free of troubles.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Distant Travelers, Listen to this World's Prayer 2.mp4

speaker: Aglaea
line: Did you feel that? The golden threads are rippling. They reveal the distrust you still have for Okhema, and I take it upon myself to dispel these concerns.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You learned the legends of Amphoreus from those bath sprites a while ago, but that was a sanitized version that spared you from the harsh and bitter realities of our history.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The pantheon of Titans that once ruled our world has become the very affliction that eats away at Amphoreus. An unfathomable power changed something within most of these Titans, inducing their rage and madness.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Amphoreus has since fallen into eternal night, the black tide engulfing our world. Okhema is now the only city to still receive light, and we owe it to Kephale 's protection.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The Chrysos Heirs gathered here are Amphoreus's only hope. People hail us as heroes, as protectors, and as deliverers...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...They are counting on us to vanquish the Titans, reclaim their Coreflames, topple them from their thrones, and take their authority for ourselves.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It is only upon reclaiming all Coreflames that the miracle of genesis can reveal itself, granting a new lease on life to this broken world.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This is Amphoreus' Flame-Chase Journey — " a band of heroes dedicated to slaying the gods and reclaiming the twelve Coreflames for the world to start over anew. "

speaker: Aglaea
line: With the end times before us, we are expected to lead all of our people toward the summit. Okhema needs as many allies as possible, to aid us in the upcoming battles.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The two of you may be just the "reinforcements" that the Chrysos Heirs have been waiting for.

text: You think too highly of us...

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: If I'm putting my hopes in the wrong place, so be it. But for Amphoreus, I am willing to take the chance.

text: Saving the world is what we do best.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: You must have been blessed by many miracles to say that with such unwavering confidence.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: I may be getting ahead of myself, but for Amphoreus, I am willing to take a chance on you.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I have laid my heart bare, and in return, I just want you to make a single promise.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Promise me to never tell the people of Okhema about the worlds beyond the sky , no matter what may happen.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: I'm glad to hear that. Please understand, Okhema is approaching its end, and I do not wish to give my people false hope... Not when we've been badly scarred by it before.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Okhema is approaching its end. I do not wish to give my people false hope... Not when we've been badly scarred by it before.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Can you promise me that?

text: I have to, for the sake of the Trailblaze.
Media:Trailblaze Mission Distant Travelers, Listen to this World's Prayer 1.mp4

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ Thank you, (Trailblazer). The agreement between us is now complete.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I apologize if this ritual upset you, but I hope you understand... I had no other choice.

speaker: Aglaea
line: As much as I am interested to hear your story, I'm afraid I've already taken up too much of your time... Mr. Dan Heng's worrying has created ripples in the water.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Why don't the both of you tour our "holy city"? See how our people make ends meet in this difficult time. I will have your welcome gifts ready later today.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Why don't you and Mr. Dan Heng tour our "holy city"? See how our people make ends meet in this difficult time. I will have your welcome gifts ready later today.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You're finally back. What did she say to you?

text: Relay the information obtained from Aglaea and the agreement reached with her to Dan Heng...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Promise not to tell her people about our interstellar voyages... I didn't expect that to be her only concern. Though this is consistent with how Phainon was acting when we were at the Abyss .

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Something is definitely off about this world. Even on a planet as isolated as Jarilo-VI , the people still had an understanding of space, and even Paths and Aeons .

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The sky above Amphoreus, though, is more like... a prison. They clearly have advanced technology, so who could imagine that even discussing what's beyond the sky would be taboo?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Do you remember the mass of chaotic matter concealing Amphoreus from the rest of the universe? I can't help thinking that someone is intentionally keeping Amphoreus hidden. Their Titans could also be related to some Aeon.

text: This is indeed a foggy situation.
I can't stop thinking about your broken spear...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Phainon promised to fix it. We can ask him about it when we see him.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's explore the city like Aglaea suggested. We helped defend their city, after all. This is a good chance to fish around for information while they still have a good impression of us.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We can also take some photos for our records.

title: Step Description
content: Okhema, the holy city... It is said to be the only place with eternal daylight amidst the end times' Long Night. We decide to tour the city to familiarize ourselves with the area and gather reliable information.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That's fast. The citizens are already back in the city.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Why are they gathered there?

speaker: Okhema Resident 1
line: Come on... Put in more strength!

speaker: Okhema Resident 2
line: Why did it have to fall right in front of our home...

speaker: Okhema Resident 3
line: Maybe someone should go fetch a priest?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Excuse me... Do you guys need help?

speaker: Disturbed Resident
line: You are...? What strange clothing and accent you have...

speaker: Disturbed Resident
line: Oh! Are you the warriors that followed Lord Phainon back from the frontier?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Looks like Phainon is helping Aglaea keep that secret, too. There must be some kind of understanding among the Chrysos Heirs.

text: Looks like Phainon is helping Aglaea keep that secret, too.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Yeah, there must be some kind of understanding among the Chrysos Heirs.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That's nowhere near as puzzling as how we have a common tongue.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Yes, that's us.

speaker: Disturbed Resident
line: Thank goodness... I hear you're both exceptional warriors as masterful as the Chrysos Heirs. Could you help us restore this column here?

speaker: Disturbed Resident
line: Nothing has been going right these days. First those minions of Nikador attack, and now this column collapses right outside our home... Can we really keep going?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Restore it...? With just human effort, that's going to take a couple of days, at least.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Not with human effort, of course, silly!

speaker: Disturbed Resident
line: High Priest Tribbie! O Kephale on high, our prayers are heard! We won't need to trouble you any further, kind warriors.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Oh... He thought we could summon miracles.

text: I did feel something strange in me...

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Eh? When we all arrived in Okhema? Come to think of it, we felt something a bit odd, too.

text: Surmount the myriad passages of Janus ...

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Eh? You can recite this, too? Wait, did you also chant this when we arrived in Okhema?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Maybe... you also have the ability learn Oronyx's prayers , too?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is that rare?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Not at all! We have lots of priests here, but some are more gifted than others.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Why don't you both try chanting? Tribbie will see if you get it!

text: In Amphoreus, memory-laden objects can be found everywhere. When the Trailblazer approaches, they reveal an energy ripple over them. At this point, by holding down the button, you can use "Oronyx's Prayer" to rewind them to their previous state from a certain time ago. In Amphoreus, memory-laden objects can be found everywhere. When the Trailblazer approaches, they reveal an energy ripple over them. At this point, by holding down the button, you can use "Oronyx's Prayer" to rewind them to their previous state from a certain time ago. The power of Oronyx's Prayer has limitations. Under normal conditions, it can only be sustained for three seconds . If used beyond three seconds without the object rewinding to the critical time point, it will return to its state prior to activating the ability. The power of Oronyx's Prayer has limitations. Under normal conditions, it can only be sustained for three seconds . If used beyond three seconds without the object rewinding to the critical time point, it will return to its state prior to activating the ability.

html_content:
(Interactive tutorial)
TapTapon mobile/PressPresson controller/ClickClickon keyboard and hold the button to activate Oronyx's Prayer to rewind time.

speaker: Tribbie
line: ▶ Wow... (Trailblazer) got it on the first try! You're a natural!

speaker: Disturbed Resident
line: A miracle ... A miracle fresh from the oven! Go, bring word to the bard: Frontier heroes grace Okhema, feats abound right here...

text: They also teach journalism here in Amphoreus?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I don't seem to be cut out for this.

speaker: Tribbie
line: That's okay, there are many others like you. It just means you're meant to be a warrior!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Ooh, you met Agy, right? How did your chat go?

text: I now know all there is to know about you...

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Really? That's pretty impressive!

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Alrighty, as long as things are going well!

speaker: Tribbie
line: You know, we are pretty certain there's more to your sudden... arrival to Okhema. And Tribbie has never seen a priest achieve resonance with Oronyx on their first try.

speaker: Tribbie
line: But with this, you should be able to clear any obstacle when traveling around Amphoreus... Um, most of the time, at least.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Oh, right... We came by to check if you have teleslates with you. It'll be a lot easier to get around Okhema with them.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Teleslates...?

text: (pull out your phone) You mean this device?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Yeah! We knew it, there are also Janusopolis priests beyond the sk — um, beyond Okhema... like the city you're from!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Let's see... This looks different, but it works more or less the same. Hmm, maybe a little resonance will do the trick...

speaker: Tribbie
line: All set! Now we can contact one another with our teleslates. Only in Okhema though. Messages won't send once you're outside Agy's web of golden threads.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That is... surprising.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Hah, did you think we were some backwater people who don't understand anything?

speaker: Tribbie
line: You can also use any currency you have on you. Talanton 's scales will determine the value of all items, so there's no need to worry about being penniless in the holy city!

text: Won't that mess up the economy?

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Not if it's just the two of you. But if any of the Council Elders happen to ask... it's our little secret~!

text: Oh, so we have to pay for our own food and accommodation...

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Hmm? Were you expecting otherwise...?

text: Titans are really capable of anything...

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: We know, right? Aren't Titans amazing?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Okay, time to get back to work. Have fun exploring the city! We'll see you two later!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...The list of inexplicable things only gets longer.

text: (Pans over to a man on a roof)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Look, someone's on the roof.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That should be a good vantage point to photograph the city. Let's find a way up.

speaker: Okhema Resident 1
line: A miracle... A miracle fresh from the oven!

speaker: Okhema Resident 1
line: Go, bring word to the bard.

speaker: Okhema Resident 1
line: Frontier heroes grace Okhema, feats abound right here...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: An excellent lookout over the city. We can even see that Titan statue. Let's get a photo of this view.

speaker: Damionis
line: What are you two doing up here?

speaker: Damionis
line: I know you. You're the heroes who helped defend our city, right? I, Damionis, saw your valiant figures in the battle.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Nice to meet you. We're... soldiers from a faraway city.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's our first time in Okhema, so we thought we'd find a nice vantage point to... uh, create...? No, capture...? I mean, to remember this city and its sights by.

speaker: Damionis
line: Oh... You mean to say "take a photo," don't you?

text: (Try hard to hold back your laughter)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Ahem, yes. I meant to say that.

speaker: Damionis
line: Aha! You met the right person! The name's Damionis, and I may have some humble insight on travel and photography... After all, everyone in this holy city knows me as the explorer!

speaker: Damionis
line: Alright, pass me your photostone .

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...I'm not even going to bother guessing their logic for naming things.

text: You give March 7th 's camera to Damionis...

speaker: Damionis
line: Oh, this is an entirely foreign make. But that's not going to stop me! I'm guessing this here... and that... Hah! Easy-peasy, I know how to use this now.

text: What is it? Cat got your tongue?
Didn't you say you knew how to use it?

speaker: Damionis
line: ...It's no biggie! Okay, strike your poses and look this way!

speaker: Damionis
line: And... we're done! Here, have a look!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Not bad.

text: A greater aperture and a shallower depth of field would work better.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Don't be so nitpicky.

text: Can you also apply some filters?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Let's leave that to March.

speaker: Damionis
line: Heh, as long as you're happy with the photos.

speaker: Damionis
line: Say, I've been wanting to ask you guys something. I didn't think I'd actually get the chance but...

speaker: Damionis
line: You're... You're not really from another city, are you?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I don't think I understand your question.

speaker: Damionis
line: I've heard some things here and there. Refugees that just came into the city are saying that the people Lord Phainon picked up are from beyond the sky.

text: Pfft, did he really pick us up?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Sorry to disappoint you, sir. I'm afraid those rumors are just rumors.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We're from Thalassopolis, a sparsely populated frontier village. Our journey to the holy city was fraught with challenges but thankfully, we were able to make our way here after meeting Phainon at the Abyss.

speaker: Damionis
line: Thalassopolis...?

speaker: Damionis
line: Oh, is that so... I... I'd thought that I had finally found proof that a world beyond the sky exists.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Hey, remember the agreement.

speaker: Damionis
line: Haha, it doesn't matter! At any rate, thanks for your help, warriors of Thalassopolis.

speaker: Damionis
line: Okhema welcomes you.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That was close, but I have a bad feeling about this.

text: That was a good story, Dan Heng.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I don't think that we managed to fool him.

text: I don't think that we managed to fool him.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: After all, Thalassopolis was something I came up with on the fly. If he's truly an explorer familiar with the geography of Amphoreus, I'm afraid that he'll have already seen through our lies.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Fortunately, there's no evidence. But... it seems like even though the starry sky is taboo on Amphoreus, there are people who still yearn for it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Looks like we have to be even more cautious.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Where should we go next?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Right, we were going to explore the city before we got distracted.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Look, Phainon is over there.

speaker: Chartonus
line: ...Out of the shadow of the past, you've not stepped, Chrysos Heir.

speaker: Chartonus
line: The weight of the Coreflame, if you wish to bear... You must bury the past, suspend the pain.

speaker: Phainon
line: I'll try my best, Chartonus. But why keep mentioning it if you already know I can't do it?

speaker: Chartonus
line: ...Here, your guests are.

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), Dan Heng! You're back much quicker than I imagined. I thought that Aglaea would keep you for a bit longer.

speaker: Phainon
line: Here you go. This is the compensation that I previously mentioned. I asked the most famous Grand Craftsman in the holy city to repair your spear.

speaker: Phainon
line: Once again, let me offer my sincere apologies for any offense I caused during our first meeting.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Judging solely from its exterior, I cannot see any signs of damage. It's truly incredible.

speaker: Phainon
line: The one who crafted this spear must also be a renowned master. I guess there's always someone greater out there. Although I still can't imagine a world outside Amphoreus.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Or perhaps I've just never given it much thought until I met you two.

speaker: Phainon
line: You've probably now heard about the tripartite prophecy that descended upon Amphoreus and the mission of the Chrysos Heirs. For us, pursuing the prophecy is the purpose of our journey. Therefore, thinking too much about other things is unnecessary.

text: And who was is exactly that issued the prophecy?

speaker: Phainon
line: It's considered a prophecy because it manifested as a miracle, though its origin or whose will it represents remains unknown.

speaker: Phainon
line: There's another theory that it is the whispers of Kephale before their eternal slumber. It was the sky father who scattered their divine blood all over the land that gave rise to the Chrysos Heirs... Of course, this is just one of many popular folktales.

speaker: Phainon
line: Please don't simply dismiss it as silly superstition. The people of this world have already experienced the transition from skepticism to firm belief, and this transition wasn't easy to achieve. Many have paid the price.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What Aglaea conveyed to us was more of a collective mission. As an individual, what role do you play in all of this, Phainon?

speaker: Phainon
line: Me? I'm still seeking that answer myself.

speaker: Phainon
line: But if the gods favor me, I believe that my Coreflame won't be far.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It's Nikador .

speaker: Phainon
line: I'm a soldier who was taught how to fight at a young age. From the day I was selected by the prophecy, I've regarded the Lance of Fury as my goal.

speaker: Phainon
line: One day, I'll break the lance and take the Coreflame of Strife.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...But discussing such a bitter topic is a bummer. I'm embarrassed since I think I'm the one who brought it up.

speaker: Phainon
line: Oh right, Tribbie mentioned that you two also use teleslates. Why don't we exchange contacts? Please also accept these gifts as a token of my appreciation.

speaker: Phainon
line: Since the weather is great, why don't you two look around some more? I won't take up more of your time. See you later.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Your spear, not too serious, the damage. Has been completed, the repair.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That's... the lady we encountered previously.

speaker: Castorice
line: Ah... It's our two distinguished guests.

speaker: Castorice
line: Welcome to the dwelling of the dromases... Well, I'm also just passing by.

text: The air here isn't too fresh...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Really? I find it rather sweet... It's the fragrance of life.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Yes. I enjoy the air here. It's rather sweet... Full of the fragrance of life.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Speaking of which, is Miss Castorice also a Chrysos Heir?

speaker: Castorice
line: Yes.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...My apologies. If you don't wish to talk about this topic, I'll stop myself here.

speaker: Castorice
line: Thank you, Mr. Dan Heng.

text: Should I show off my dance moves?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...No, thank you. Unless you wish to make things worse.

text: (point at the dromas) Let's liven up the atmosphere!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...It seems to have understood you, but it's choosing to ignore you.

speaker: Dromas
line: ...Grumph!

speaker: Castorice
line: Oh, this child looks hungry.

speaker: Castorice
line: Since you are here, do you two want to try feeding the dromases?

text: Take out a small amount of dromas feed

speaker: Castorice
line: Their feed is dry redsoil and it's very clean. There is some over there.

speaker: Castorice
line: Since it's your first time feeding, just a small piece will do.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Of course, but it's very bitter and hard to digest.

children.text: ...Her serious tone immediately quashes your wild idea.

text: You gently pick up a piece of red clay from the container, while the dromas watches your every move intently... Don't mess it up.

speaker: Castorice
line: Their feed is dry redsoil and it's very clean. There is some over there.

speaker: Dromas
line: Grumph...

text: The dromas lets out a slow but joyful sound, clearly anticipating your performance as its new caretaker.
Should it get what it wants so easily, or...?
Offer the feed to Dan Heng.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...That's not gonna happen.

children.text: Darn it, when did he learn to read minds?

text: Eat the feed in front of the dromas.

children.text: You stare intently at the red clay in your hand, then look up to check the dromas' expression.

children.speaker: Dromas
children.line: ...Grumph?

children.text: You see confusion... hesitation... and perhaps a hint of hidden defiance. The big guy looks down at you, as if to say, "Do you have the guts, little one?"
You've never been underestimated by an animal in your life — though your life hasn't been that long. Now, there's probably only one way to save your dignity...
You take a bite from the red cube. Next to you, the two spectators who witness this gasp in disbelief.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: *wince*

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Ah...

children.text: Castorice wasn't lying. The taste of this red clay is truly... bitter. It's a bitterness unlike any medicine. It strikes the softest part of your soul, making you question the very meaning of "Trailblazing."

Surprisingly, it isn't hard, but that's not necessarily a good thing. After chewing it a few times, the sticky flecks of redsoil stain your teeth. No matter how you use your tongue, you can't get rid of it.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Drink some water.

children.text: You hold the clean water in your mouth, trying hard to rinse away the remaining clay, but the bitterness lingers stubbornly...

children.speaker: Dromas
children.line: Grumphhh...

children.text: The dromas lets out a mocking cry. Now, you've not only earned its ridicule, but also the ongoing duty of feeding it...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Haha...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: That was a little unexpected. Don't worry. There's a lot more feed over there. Just go get another piece.

children.text:
(Taking another Redsoil Feed)
(Feeding the dromas again)

children.speaker: Dromas
children.line: Grumph...

children.text: The dromas lets out a slow but joyful sound, clearly anticipating your performance as its new caretaker.
Should it get what it wants so easily, or...?
Offer the redsoil feed to the dromas.

text: Offer the redsoil feed to the dromas.

speaker: Dromas
line: Grumph... Grumphhh!

speaker: Dromas
line: Grumphhhh... Grumphhh!

text: The big guy in front lets out a satisfied sound.
You don't know how it chews and digests these clumps of clay — but to them, these hard red clays must be as delicious as a freshly sizzling steak.

speaker: Dromas
line: Grumphhh!

speaker: Castorice
line: It looks very happy. Perhaps... you could try petting it?

text: Gently pat it on the head.

children.speaker: Dromas
children.line: Grumphhh... Grumphhh!

text: Rub its neck with some strength.

children.speaker: Dromas
children.line: Grumphhh... Grumphhh!

speaker: Castorice
line: It seems to enjoy it a lot. You get along very well with the dromas.

speaker: Castorice
line: It makes me envious.

text: Don't you want to try petting it as well?

speaker: Castorice
line: Me? No, thanks. It's alright...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Miss Castorice, are you concerned about something? Since we've just arrived in this area, we hope to build closer relationships with everyone through our actions.

speaker: Castorice
line: Please don't misunderstand. When you helped Okhema, you already showed ample goodwill. It's just that I...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...am not too good with social "contact." Regardless of whether it's with people or with these children.

speaker: Castorice
line: So, please don't take it to heart.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ ...Alright. (Trailblazer), take a photo of the dromas as well. It's rare to encounter such an amazing creature.

speaker: Castorice
line: Would you two like a photo with this child? In that case, I might be able to help.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Yes, it is an interest of mine.

text: You don't have to force yourself.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: That's not it. Photography is an interest of mine.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Alright then. Thanks for your help.

speaker: Castorice
line: No problem. Please place the photostone on the ground.

text: Can't I just hand it to you?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Let's just do as she says.

text: You put March 7th's camera on the ground, and Castorice bends down to pick it up...

speaker: Castorice
line: What beautiful colors. It's... very cute.

speaker: Castorice
line: The aperture, exposure index, and preset filter... Although it looks different on the outside, it actually has the same internal structure. There won't be any issues.

speaker: Castorice
line: Alright, get into position.

speaker: Castorice
line: And we're done. I hope that you like it.

text: Castorice gently places the camera on the ground, and you bend down to pick it up.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...But, what's the reason behind using the black and white filter?

speaker: Castorice
line: Ah... My apologies, it's just personal preference. I like black and white photos. If it bothers you, I can take another photo.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That won't be necessary. This is fine.

speaker: Castorice
line: I'm glad that I could help.

speaker: Castorice
line: Then, I'll take my leave now. Please continue playing with the dromases.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: You could say she's not very talkative? No, that's not it, she's just a little elusive.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: You could say she's not very talkative? No, that's not it, she's just a little elusive.

text: There's even a stand-in photographer in the "script"?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Why are you speaking like a Stellaron Hunter all of a sudden?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: You could say Miss Castorice is not very talkative? No, that's not it, she's just a little elusive.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Even when we came across her previously, she avoided having physical contact with others...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: These Chrysos Heirs all have wildly different personalities. In comparison, Phainon seems like the most normal one.

text: (Receive a message fromTribbie, Dan Heng, and (Trailblazer)'s Group Chat)

Messages Tribbie, Dan Heng, and (Trailblazer)'s Group Chat Tribbie Hello, Dan Heng! (Trailblazer)! How's Marmoreal Market looking to you guys? We've wandered plenty (Trailblazer) We've wandered plenty. Run into lots of interesting people and things Plenty of interesting people (Trailblazer) We've wandered plenty. Run into lots of interesting people and things Tribbie That's nice! As long as you enjoyed yourself The baths have also returned to their original bustling state from before the war. Once you're done walking around, come find us back at Marmoreal Palace Aglaea's prepared a huge gift for you!
(Optional) Continue to explore the Okhema city area

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Should we return to Marmoreal Palace? Or do you want to wander around for a bit more?

text: The murals record in simple and delicate carvings the stories of Kephale creating life and building Okhema.

In the murals, Kephale bears the enormous Dawn Device on their back. Golden divine blood courses across their body, flowing to the ground from the left-hand side of their chest and spreading in all directions.
At their feet, the humans bathed in the golden blood work together to create a great city. This city is Okhema, the origin of Amphoreus civilization.

speaker: Bard
line: ...The strife of day and night birthed the all-knowing giant. Their feet measure the earth and their back carries the dawn and dusk.

speaker: Bard
line: With the night as their curtain, they dreamt until they awoke. Only then did they realize: My perfection was born for creation.

speaker: Bard
line: Gods, please hear my wish:

speaker: Bard
line: Craft my likeness with fresh earth, and grant my intellect with your fruits. Illuminate my emotions with the wings of a butterfly and forge my fate with golden blood.

speaker: Bard
line: The perfect gods created the very first humans, and the first humans created the first city.

speaker: Bard
line: Okhema! Standing at the foot of the Throne of Worlds , your golden blood can be traced back to the very beginning.

speaker: Bard
line: Though the black tide devours the ancient lands, the holy city will cross over to a new world...

speaker: Phainon
line: Ma'am, this item of yours is new! Completely new! There's no doubt about it.

speaker: Elderly Appraiser
line: T—That's impossible! This is an heirloom that's been passed down by my ancestors... Where's Theodoros? Get him over here to take a look!

speaker: Phainon
line: Although I'm not as experienced at doing appraisals as he is, I'm very confident about this. If you don't trust me, you can take it elsewhere for a second opinion.

speaker: Phainon
line: Or, I can burn it for you? You'll be able to tell once you smell it!

speaker: Elderly Appraiser
line: N—No way! You can't burn my family heirloom!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I never would've thought that Phainon had such a hobby...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: He seems to be dealing with someone difficult right now. Let's leave him to it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: He seems to be dealing with someone difficult right now. Let's leave him to it.

text: Prepare to return to Marmoreal Palace

title: Step Description
content: As we prepared to return to the bath chamber, March 7th's photographs were unexpectedly leaked, and she was celebrated by the residents of Okhema as the "Rosy Celestial Maiden," causing quite a stir.

speaker: Charming Citizen
line: Hey, are you in the forum ?

speaker: Bored Citizen
line: Forum? Which one?

speaker: Charming Citizen
line: The one about the Rosy Celestial Maiden . Its getting more popular by the minute! I don't see you in there yet. Hurry up! It's filling up quickly.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Rosy Celestial Maiden, forum...

text: I'm starting to get a little curious too.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I have a strange feeling about this. I hope that it's not what I think it is... Let's go take a look.

text: Speak with the citizen who are talking about the Rosy Celestial Maiden

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Excuse me, we accidentally overheard something about a forum just now... We would like to find out more.

speaker: Charming Citizen
line: Hmm? Your outfits, who exactly...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We're warriors from a foreign land who assisted in the defense of Okhema.

speaker: Charming Citizen
line: Ah, brave warriors, pardon me! I didn't expect you to be interested in such social affairs, but sure thing.

speaker: Charming Citizen
line: Please take out your teleslate. I'll help you connect to Okhema's World Wound Web .

text: Oh, it's actually an online discussion forum!

speaker: Charming Citizen
line: Got it! Please take a look!

text: Messages Rosy Celestial Maiden Discussion Group Sky-Breaching Explorer It was as I said. The Rosy Celestial Maiden doesn't resemble someone from Amphoreus no matter what And there are so many wonders you won't see in Amphoreus in that photostone: A world of snow, countless small boats in the sky, splendorous skyscrapers... The "world beyond the sky" is real! Zagreus Give Me Money Her hair was pink, and she wore a short blue blouse, and her eyes were as the sea reflecting the light of sunset... Is this seriously not Mnestia's human avatar? Just Wanna Be A Mannequin Lady Aglaea is Mnestia's ambassador Sky-Breaching Explorer Nonsense! I already said that the Rosy Celestial Maiden isn't from Amphoreus! She's from beyond the sky! The 13th Titan I'll admit that I've read a great many unofficial historical records, but the Skyship Calamity is not an apocryphal tale! It is a tragedy that really happened No one can pass the sky dome while Aquila maintains their baleful gaze... After all, it's questionable if any world beyond the sky even exists! Phagousa Is Still Drinking Even the existence of the Rosy Celestial Maiden is in dispute Just Wanna Be A Mannequin I still have a few attires made by Lady Aglaea herself. I hope I can make the Rosy Celestial Maiden's acquaintance with these supreme garbs as a gift! Sky-Breaching Explorer I told you I saw it with my own eyes! The 13th Titan Really? Then I saw Nikador and Kephale clasping hands in a gesture of peace with my own eyes! Zagreus Give Me Money My dear explorer, you're speaking drivel. You must have been deceived by Zagreus Sky-Breaching Explorer I speak with honesty, and you treat me like this...? Fine. So be it. I'll prove the existence of the world beyond the sky through my own means! Just watch me! I will soar to the world beyond the sky Even if I have to risk my own life, I'll find the Rosy Celestial Maiden and silence you all!

speaker: (Trailblazer) & Dan Heng
line: ▶ Oh no!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That Damionis guy who took a photo for us... It must be him! He must have opened the album and saw the photos that March 7th previously took.

text: March 7th has now become a celestial maiden.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That's beside the point.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: There are more than a hundred people in here. Although no one believes what Damionis is saying now, we don't know what he'll do next. If the situation gets out of control, the consequences might be disastrous.

text: I hope that the Chrysos Heirs are too busy to surf the web.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Quick! We have to find Damionis before things get worse.

text: Head to the baths to inquire about Damionis' whereabouts

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ There are so many people all of a sudden...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: At a time like this... Why not ask around?

speaker: Romantic Citizen
line: Rosy Celestial Maiden, Okhema's light...

speaker: Romantic Citizen
line: Rosy Celestial Maiden, just from this name alone am I able to imagine your beauty! You must be the incarnation of Mnestia . You cause me to sink deeper and deeper, unable to get a hold of myself...

speaker: Romantic Citizen
line: Oh, beautiful celestial maiden, how can I ever win your affection?

text: With snacks, plushies, and cute clothes.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...March 7th is really that simple in your eyes.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Let's get to the point.

children.text: Have you seen Damionis?

speaker: Romantic Citizen
line: Dameas? Aminos? No, I don't know what you're talking about, friend...

speaker: Romantic Citizen
line: Right now, I only have the Rosy Celestial Maiden in my heart!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I wonder what he drank. Someone should come calm him down.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's go and look elsewhere.

speaker: Dashing Citizen
line: My radiant maiden, how I wish to witness your beauty...

speaker: Dashing Citizen
line: Oh, Rosy Celestial Maiden... You truly are a gift from the heavens, a daughter of the sun!

speaker: Dashing Citizen
line: Even Aquila cannot restrain you. Will you gently carve open the sky? If only to lead us out of this long dark night...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Hey.

children.text: Have you seen Damionis?

speaker: Dashing Citizen
line: Who? No. I do not care about any Damionis. Right now...

speaker: Dashing Citizen
line: ...I only have beautiful fantasies and poems in my heart! Oh, Rosy Celestial Maiden, the light of Okhema...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Next.

speaker: Sensible Citizen
line: The maiden talk is just a lie!

speaker: Sensible Citizen
line: Dear citizens, please stop spreading images of unknown origins!

speaker: Sensible Citizen
line: Please wake up! The Rosy Celestial Maiden is a lie crafted by Zagreus as a prank. We should follow the lead of Lady Aglaea and not subject ourselves to such mind-numbing fantasies...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Don't stir up trouble.

children.text: Have you seen Damionis?

speaker: Sensible Citizen
line: Damionis? That explorer who thinks very highly of himself?

speaker: Sensible Citizen
line: I've heard of him but have never met him in person. Others have said that he's completely crazy—
Rosy Celestial Maiden! A world beyond the sky!

speaker: Sensible Citizen
line: What's that commotion?

text: A world beyond the sky? Can you even speak of that?
I wanna be high up like that too!

speaker: Damionis
line: Stop chasing after me! Don't come any closer!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's really Damionis! Let's give chase.

title: Step Description
content: The "Rosy Celestial Maiden" fiasco almost caused someone their life. We rescued the persistent Damionis at the cost of exposing our identities as guests from beyond the sky. But in doing so... we broke our promise to Aglaea.

speaker: Holy City Guard
line: He's running toward the Garden of Life . Give chase!

speaker: Damionis
line: I'm Damionis! And I will prove it to everyone!

speaker: Merchant 1
line: What's all this fuss...

speaker: Merchant 1
line: Can't a guy run his business in peace?

speaker: Citizen 2
line: That guy...

speaker: Citizen 2
line: Barged into the Chrysos Heirs' baths?

speaker: Citizen 3
line: He was just shouting about... the Rosy Celestial Maiden?

speaker: Citizen 3
line: Maybe we should go home to stay safe...

speaker: Child 4
line: Celestial maiden! Celestial maiden!

speaker: Child 4
line: I want to become a celestial maiden one day!

speaker: Parent 5
line: Stop that nonsense!

speaker: Parent 5
line: Be realistic!

speaker: Kind Guard
line: Citizen! Calm down. Don't do anything foolish!

speaker: Impulsive Guard
line: This is the Garden of Life, the holy ground of the Bough of Rift ! Are you trying to defile the gods?

speaker: Damionis
line: Defile the gods? No, you guys are completely wrong! The wise Cerces will be proud of me. Just watch!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What is he trying to do? Let's get closer and take a look.

speaker: Damionis
line: The wisdom of Cerces should be shared equally by all.

speaker: Damionis
line: I, explorer Damionis, shall put on these wings today and touch the sky — proving to everyone that a world beyond the sky exists!

speaker: Impulsive Guard
line: ...Wings?

speaker: Damionis
line: That's right — right here, right now!

speaker: Impulsive Guard
line: That is a giant Flying Amphora. You're going to fall to your death!

speaker: Damionis
line: Heh, ridicule me all you want. I shall prove myself and remove all doubts!

text: Use the clockwork tricks on him!

children.text: Clockie doesn't react.
You think you can use a Penaconian key to open an Amphorean lock? Ha, that's wishful thinking!

text: I think he's going to die.
Do you think he will succeed?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Obviously not.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We can't stand by and watch him die. Let's go.

speaker: Kind Guard
line: You two are... the distinguished guests of Lady Aglaea?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Mr. Damionis, please calm down. Don't act rashly.

speaker: Damionis
line: ...My dear friends, I know that you must have your own reasons to hide the truth. I shall not make things difficult for you.

speaker: Damionis
line: But thank you for showing me the image from beyond the sky. Now, I shall embark on this earthshaking undertaking — Damionis always follows through on his words!

text: We believe you, we really do!

speaker: Damionis
line: Save your words of persuasion. I've made up my mind.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Since appeasing him did not work, it's time for a change in strategy.

children.speaker: Damionis
children.line: Haha, my friend, your tone has betrayed you! I understand that you're trying to persuade me to stay...

children.speaker: Damionis
children.line: Haha, trying to enrage me in hopes that my emotions will overwhelm my mission? It's... It's a pity that I've seen through your intentions. You're... You're trying to persuade me to stay...

speaker: Impulsive Guard
line: A clever fool. That's how to describe people like him, right?

speaker: Kind Guard
line: I'm almost moved by his persistence...

speaker: Damionis
line: Save your words. Aquila , feel my wrath!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We're running out of time...

text: Dan Heng, what should we do!?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's a human life after all! There's no choice. Let's just tell him...

text: A world beyond the sky really exists!

speaker: Impulsive Guard
line: What... did you just say?

speaker: Damionis
line: So... I was right? You really are from... beyond the sky?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...We are bound by a pact. I cannot reveal the truth to you.

speaker: Damionis
line: A pact? Ah, so that's why he called you "distinguished guests of Aglaea"...

speaker: Impulsive Guard
line: Damionis! We're taking you in for an interrogation!

text: Damionis was dragged away by the guards before he could finish his sentence.

speaker: Kind Guard
line: This is not going to go well.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What will happen to Damionis?

speaker: Kind Guard
line: He learned something that he should never have learned. We can only hand him over to Lady Aglaea for judgment.

speaker: Kind Guard
line: Instead of worrying about his safety, perhaps you guys should worry about the impact of the rumors. Although no one believes what Damionis said about a world beyond the sky, the Rosy Celestial Maiden has already spread everywhere.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...We're sorry for the trouble that we caused.

speaker: Kind Guard
line: It's alright. I think there's only one thing you can do right now. Go to Verax Leo and share something even more interesting with him. That way, there's a chance that you can cover up the rumors.

speaker: Kind Guard
line: As for what happened earlier... We won't tell anyone else about it. So, go now, brave heroes.

text: Search for Verax Leo to try calm the storm

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This is going to be difficult. Let's try to salvage the situation before Aglaea finds out...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What's this? It looks like one of those mannequins in the clothing stores of Penacony .

speaker: Dan Heng
line: There's also a... butterfly? Is that a fashion accessory?

speaker: Goldenfly
line: Now there's a warrior I've never seen before... Pretty cute, too... I like it...

text: Babe, you are a talking butterfly...
It's obvious that you're not a real human!

speaker: Goldenfly
line: Wow~ You actually saw straight through my disguise. Don't tell me you're my lady's priest, are you? I haven't seen them in a long time...

speaker: Goldenfly
line: What a shame! If you were also nymphs, we could have had a lot of fun together.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...How intriguing.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We should catch these nymphs the next time we encounter them... Perhaps they can help us better understand Amphoreus.

text: Nymphs with blessings are everywhere in Amphoreus. Approach and interact to collect the nymphs, and bring their blessings to Aglaea. Nymphs with blessings are everywhere in Amphoreus. Approach and interact to collect the nymphs, and bring their blessings to Aglaea. After collecting all the nymphs of an area , the Garmentmaker will begin deciphering the prophecy and may provide unexpected information to unknown surprises. After collecting all the nymphs of an area , the Garmentmaker will begin deciphering the prophecy and may provide unexpected information to unknown surprises.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Isn't that Tribbie's sister...

speaker: Snack Vendor Nike
line: Gosh, isn't this Lady Trinnon? How rare that you would leave the Garden of Wisdom.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Yeah... I came out to clear my mind.

speaker: Snack Vendor Nike
line: Then you've come to the right place! Look at all these snacks that I've just gotten. They are all flavors that you and your sisters love!

speaker: Snack Vendor Nike
line: Lady Trianne's favorite sour melon candies, Lady Tribbie's favorite butter cookies, and your favorite stuffed grape leaves. We have everything!

speaker: Trinnon
line: Oh, that's indeed tempting...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Since we haven't solved the Rosy Celestial Maiden problem yet... Let's avoid the Chrysos Heirs for now.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Since we haven't solved the Rosy Celestial Maiden problem yet... Let's avoid the Chrysos Heirs for now.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Verax Leo... should be nearby.

speaker: Art Merchant
line: Rosy Celestial Maiden merch! Come get them right here!

speaker: Art Merchant
line: Dear customers, good early morning, late morning, noon!

speaker: Art Merchant
line: Would you like to check out my merch? Look, I have this very popular artwork — Nikador Battles the Rosy Celestial Maiden !

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: The speed of the artists here is just as astonishing as everywhere else...

text: Is this even remotely related to March 7th...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: It'll probably work if we change the title to How March Sees Herself in Her Dreams ...

speaker: Art Merchant
line: What do you think? Are you interested?

children.speaker: Art Merchant
children.line: Deal! Now, this Nikador Battles the Rosy Celestial Maiden is yours!

children.speaker: Art Merchant
children.line: However, since you like this so much, would you like to take a look at another piece that I have? It's titled Phainon and Pie-non .

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: No, thank you. Let's go.

children.text: (ObtainArtwork Nikador Battles the Rosy Celestial Maiden×1)

children.speaker: Art Merchant
children.line: Alright, feel free to look for me at anytime if you change your mind.

text: (Talk to the Art Merchant again after declining, optional)

speaker: Art Merchant
line: So, have you decided to purchase Nikador Battles the Rosy Celestial Maiden ?

children.speaker: Art Merchant
children.line: Deal! Now, this Nikador Battles the Rosy Celestial Maiden is yours!

children.speaker: Art Merchant
children.line: However, since you like this so much, would you like to take a look at another piece that I have? It's titled Phainon and Pie-non .

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: No, thank you. Let's go.

children.text: (ObtainArtwork Nikador Battles the Rosy Celestial Maiden×1)

children.speaker: Art Merchant
children.line: Alright, feel free to look for me at anytime if you change your mind.

text: (Talk to the Art Merchant again, optional)

speaker: Art Merchant
line: Rosy Celestial Maiden merch! Come get them right here!

text: (Approach the pool nearCourt of Seasonsspace anchor, optional)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The water in this bath... is very cold.

text: Is there anyone who is fond of cold water baths?
Do you want to go in?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The Vidyadhara prefer cooler waters over hot baths. It's our... nature.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You can try it out when you get the chance, but now is not the time. Let's go look for Verax Leo first.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What kind of decoration is this? A mask?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It feels like this ram's mask is hiding something... Let's try touching it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This is Verax Leo? It really is a lion's... head?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: No matter how I look at it, it just looks like any other statue. How do we even interact with it?

text: Whack it with the baseball bat.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Even if it's just a decoration, we will still have to pay if we damage public property.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Since its mouth is open, perhaps we can try putting our hands into it?

children.text: (Put your hand into the lion's mouth.)

text: (Put your hand into the lion's mouth.)

speaker: Verax Leo
line: Roarrr! Look who came to visit this mighty lion!

speaker: Verax Leo
line: Aren't you Okhema's two new friends? The brave warriors from a faraway place? It's an honor to meet you, roarrr!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It seems like you're very well-informed.

speaker: Verax Leo
line: Didn't anyone tell you? I'm the far-seeing eye and all-hearing ear of Okhema. I see and hear every single thing that happens in the streets and alleys of this place.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We would like to request your help. Currently, rumors regarding the Rosy Celestial Maiden have spread throughout the holy city...

speaker: Verax Leo
line: Roarrr! Brave warriors, I'm afraid that I won't be able to help with that.

speaker: Verax Leo
line: Rumors? Hah! As long as the citizens like it, who cares about whether it's true or not? However, the way you two are trying to stop it from spreading further... Could there be some other reason? How about sharing it with me?

text: Why are you so interested in the tea?

line: Don't be fooled by it. This lion loves engaging in gossip and rumors.

speaker: Mydei
line: A few days ago, when people were besmirching my tribe's honor, didn't you also turn a blind eye?

speaker: Verax Leo
line: O—Oh, roarrr! Isn't this Lord Mydei! H—How have you been lately?

speaker: Mydei
line: The face of a lion but the courage of a soulless hyena.

speaker: Mydei
line: You and your brothers will do anything for the sake of entertainment, even encouraging despicable acts such as fabricating history. There's no limit to how low you would stoop.

speaker: Verax Leo
line: H—How can you call that a fabrication? At most, it's just a little... umm... reinterpretation! Artistic reinterpretation!

speaker: Mydei
line: Shut it!

speaker: Mydei
line: Do as they say. Otherwise... I'll turn you into iron dust with my bare hands.

speaker: Verax Leo
line: Roar! Y—You got it. I'll fix that right now!

speaker: Verax Leo
line: I assure all of you that from now on, you'll no longer hear the words "Rosy Celestial Maiden"!

text: With the "cooperation" of the Verax Leo, the rumors gradually die down...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Thank you for your help.

speaker: Mydei
line: Don't misunderstand, I'm just annoyed at that lion head.

speaker: Mydei
line: Also, Phainon seems to think highly of you guys. If you were to be disposed of for such a trivial reason, his weak and fragile heart might not be able to bear it.

speaker: Mydei
line: Pray for the best, outsider. Pray that this farce has not reached the ears of Aglaea.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That boldly dressed Chrysos Heir also has an eccentric personality.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Regardless, this matter has come to an end. Let's prepare ourselves and head to our appointment.

title: Step Description
content: Fortunately, the "Rosy Celestial Maiden" fiasco was quickly resolved before the Chrysos Heirs discovered it. As a token of gratitude for saving Okhema from Nikador, Aglaea seems to have prepared a special gift for us.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: If they ask us about it, we should just come clean with everything.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: After all, we still saved a citizen's life.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Hey, over here! We've been waiting for quite some time.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Where have the two of you been? We've been waiting here for quite some time. Even our wings are tired.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We encountered some trouble, but thankfully everything has been resolved.

text: Tribbie, do you surf the web?

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Wow, you guys are well-informed. You even know about the World Wound Web? Young people sure are full of energy! But it's been such a busy day, where would we find the time to surf the web?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That's good. Surfing the web... isn't a good habit to have.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: ...What accident?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Ahem... It's nothing, don't worry about it.

speaker: Tribbie
line: What a strange thing to say... Anyway, let's go. I hope Agy isn't annoyed from waiting too long.

text: (Optional) View the Gate of Infinity from a distance

speaker: Tribbie
line: Oh right, you can see the Abyss from here. It's quite a nice place for a photo.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Look — the Gate of Infinity! It's very eye-catching, isn't it? That's where we met.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The landscape of Amphoreus is breathtaking. In the past, this place must have been a beautiful paradise.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Ah well, the past cannot be recreated. All we can do is follow the prophecy and move forward.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The past cannot be recreated? But you clearly showed us Oronyx's Miracle before.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Those are two different concepts. We can draw upon the power of the "Veil of Evernight" through prayer and then salvage necessary items from the past for our own use. It isn't actually reversing time.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Even so, it still goes against the laws of physics that we know of.

text: Is that even surprising, considering that there are also gods in this world?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Even gods have to obey the underlying laws of the world. I'm still trying to understand Amphoreus's laws.

text: I've been meaning to ask that for a while now...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: All things have to obey the underlying laws of the world. I'm still trying to understand Amphoreus's laws.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: We'll take photos later. Let's go and meet Aglaea now.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy, we're back.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Thanks for your hard work. Is there any news from Trianne?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Not yet. But we've already figured out where the deserters are headed to. With a little more time, we'll be able to track down the location of Castrum Kremnos .

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Nikador's territory and their current abode — it's a moving city-state enveloped in fog.

text: Mydei has mentioned this place before.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Oh... He's that candid with the two of you?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Castrum Kremnos, both Nikador's territory and their current abode, is a moving city-state enveloped in fog.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: So, back when the Titan was repelled, Lady Trianne was off chasing the enemy.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Let's talk about something less serious for now. Would you mind giving the three of us some space, Tribbie?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Of course. Hope you like this gift, heheh.

speaker: Aglaea
line: As Tribbie mentioned, the both of you spared no effort in protecting the holy city. I would like to present you with a gift in recognition of that.

speaker: Aglaea
line: If you are to stay in Okhema, you'll need a place to rest.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This gift will address your troubles.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Welcome to your private bath chamber .

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Indeed. It's spacious, and the decor is quite impressive.

text: It's even better than the Penaconian hotel rooms.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: While it's hard to compare them directly, this place... is indeed more spacious, and the decor is quite impressive.

text: I don't want to go back to the Astral Express anymore.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: This place is indeed spacious, and the decor is quite impressive.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I'm glad that you're satisfied with the arrangements. Here, take some time and get to know your surroundings.

text: Look around the private bath chamber

title: Step Description
content: Okhema, the holy city... It is said to be the only place with eternal daylight amidst the end times' Long Night. We decide to tour the city to familiarize ourselves with the area and gather reliable information.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I'm glad that you're satisfied with the arrangements. Here, take some time and get to know your surroundings.

text: The lounge chair in the room looks so comfy and enticing. You're worried that you'll completely lose the motivation to Trailblaze if you lie on it.
Think about it. All the twists and turns and hardships you've been through... are they worth it? Lying here and welcoming an eternal, comfy slumber... Maybe that's where you belong...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Ahem.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I know what you're thinking. Don't be tempted by a mere lounge chair.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Hm...

text: Aren't you going to test the water's temperature?
Do you like it, Cold Dragon Young?
Dan Heng dips two fingers into the bath to check the water temperature.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's lukewarm.

text: "Great," you think silently in your mind, trying hard not to let him see your schadenfreude.

You lean against the stone railing of the balcony, gazing into the distance. The mist-shrouded mountains of Amphoreus appear as vague outlines, like stone giants slowly shifting between crouching and standing.
From somewhere, a bard's song drifts through the air. Though the words are unclear, the melody still conveys a tinge of nostalgia and longing for the past.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This view is... absolutely breathtaking.

text: You agree with Dan Heng, very much so.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Finished exploring? I still have one last special gift for you.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Come this way, I'll explain it to you.

text: Enter the Vortex of Genesis via the spirit basin

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is this... a basin? It looks like something used for rituals.

text: I feel like I've seen it in a movie before.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's not your average washbasin. This ceremonial vessel belonged to the Chrysos Heirs and is now my gift to the both of you.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You have learned, to some extent, about the history of Amphoreus and of the holy city Okhema. Now... I wish for both of you to witness the journey of the Chrysos Heirs for yourselves.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What do you mean by... witness?

speaker: Aglaea
line: In ancient times, Phagousa , the Chalice of Plenty, concealed the beginning of the world amidst billowing waves.

speaker: Aglaea
line: When the ancient Ocean Priests discovered that place, they used spirit water to build a barrier in order to prevent the site from being disturbed by external forces. However, they also left behind a passageway.

speaker: Aglaea
line: That passageway is none other than the ceremonial basin in front of you. Clear yourselves of all distracting thoughts and wash your faces with the spirit water inside the basin. When you next open your eyes, you shall witness for yourselves...

speaker: Aglaea
line: The Vortex of Genesis : A great sanctuary that houses the original divinity of the twelve Titans. It's also the place where the prophesized Miracle of Genesis will occur.

text: I can't wait to see it...

speaker: Aglaea
line: For your first time, I shall personally guide you into the depths.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Close your eyes and hold your breath. Sever all other sounds and let my whispers fill your ears.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Take a handful of the pristine water, lift your palms in front of your chest, and feel the water gently flow away through your fingers...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Sink deeper and do this once more. Submerge your wrists in the spirit water. Familiarize yourself with its temperature, its touch...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Spread your fingers, then lower your head and search for the palms of your hands. Feel the spirit water flow against your face, until all of your senses are submerged...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Floating, sinking...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Diving into the depths.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: You now stand at the heart of this world.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Now, I require your "honesty."
